document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eupliozia (sic!) lurida Fabr.
: Hayward 1938 (distribution; natural history), 1941: 89 (distribution; natural history).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Euphoria bivittata
, not Gory & Percheron, 1833 :
Hayward 1944: 13
(natural history);
Hayward 1960: 24
(natural history);
Di Iorio 2004: 183
(catalog; distribution; natural history; references): misidentification.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 141. Geographic distribution of Cetoniinae from Argentina and adjacent countries:
Euphoria lurida
(circles).

Note 1 :
Euphoria bivittata
was recorded in Argentina by Hayward (1944) , which was repeated by Hayward (1960) and cataloged by Di Iorio (2004) . This record was based on an error of identification for
Euphoria lurida
, which is the only species of this genus present in the country.

Note 2 : The southern limit of
E. lurida
in Argentina is located in the province of La Pampa ( Fig. 142 ). Not recorded yet from Formosa and San Juan ( Argentina ), probably because of a lack of collecting. The record for Bolivia is a new country record.
